definition: loose/to loosen/to relax/floss (dry, fluffy food product made from shredded, seasoned meat or fish, used as a topping or filling)
to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap

sentences.english: The gag did not come out of my mouth; my hands were not loosed.
sentences.chinese: 堵嘴的東西沒有掉出來，我的手也沒有鬆綁。

sentences.english: Conclusion The victim died suddenly after a person being untied because the cerebral e…
sentences.chinese: 結論受害者鬆綁後即死主要是腦水腫即刻加重的結果。

sentences.english: The gag did not come out of my mouth;
sentences.chinese: 堵嘴的東西沒有掉出來，我的手也沒有鬆綁。

sentences.english: Then his friends freed him and took the wax out of their ears.
sentences.chinese: 這時他們纔給奧德修斯鬆綁，取出他們耳朵中的蠟。

sentences.english: Talk of decoupling is in the air again, especially here in India.
sentences.chinese: 鬆綁如今已成一紙空談，特別是在現今的印度。

sentences.english: Relaxing this restriction would lead to the development of weapons that could burrow farther.
sentences.chinese: 這項規定鬆綁之後，就可開發能鑽得更深的炸彈了。

sentences.english: You can eat to relax when you need to unwind.
sentences.chinese: 當你需要鬆綁神經時，可以通過喫東西來放鬆。

definition: ability to make one's own decisions
to turn a blind eye to
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to whine on for days (idiom)/to endlessly grumble complaints/incessant whining
